Posts.Content: FemaleAthlete wrote: OK, I really do not know where to post this question but here goes. I underwent a double mastectomy in the fall of 2015. I did not go for reconstruction at that time. About a year or so ago, I noticed a "lump", very small in size on the upper left side of my chest. I was told to not worry about it since it is probably the spot where my sutures were tied off. So, I didn't give it any more thought. Now, this very small lump is now three times it's "normal" size, and it is not soft, kinda like a marble that moves around. The other thing is this tiny sharp pain fI am getting from the area. Again, I was told it could be scar tissue - really? Scar tissue grows? So now I am all freaked out and cannot stop feeling it nor looking at it in the mirror. What should I do? you will all probably suggest I get it checked out. Which I have been putting off all week. I'm just worried is all. Thanks for listening D Dx 3/30/2015, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 7/1/2015 Lymph node removal: Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left Hormonal Therapy 9/11/2015 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worried overr marble sized mass on left breast near the armpit. FemaleAthlete FemaleAthlete
